author: sky.cactus
content: In the real world, different layers are doing each of these things.  `estimateGas`, for example, is often done by the application because they may need to add some padding that only they have the context to know about.

author: sky.cactus
content: `maxFeePerGas` on the other hand really needs to be done by the wallet based on prioritization information from the user+app.

author: sky.cactus
content: `transactionCount` also should be done by the wallet, not the node, because a user may have multiple transactions queuing up and the node may not have seen them all yet (especially if the intent is to bundle the transactions together).

author: sky.cactus
content: In other words, the Ethereum client doesn't have enough information to correctly fill out transactions in all cases, but there are some pieces that only it can do (gas estimation).
